name: BLACK MAGICK: The Art of Chet Zar
description:
(*INTERNATIONAL ORDERS PLEASE NOTE*- Shipping outside of the US is costing $30-45 for these books but for technical reasons, my PayPal will only charge $20 for shipping upon checkout. Please be aware that you will be billed an additional $10-20 for shipping. Sorry about that, but I can't find a cheaper way to ship)

Hardcover

Color

176 pages

11 x 9.25 inches

ISBN-10: 0980323142

ISBN-13: 9780980323146

Publisher: beinArt Publishing

A chronicle of Chet Zar’s eclectic career. From his beginnings in the Hollywood special-effects industry to his establishment as a widely respected fine artist, Chet’s unique world of monsters has fascinated and influenced those in fields as varied as tattooing, music and art academia.

Now, through this publication, Chet gives us unprecedented access to his story. In addition to Chet’s own reminiscences, this book offers contributions from creative forces who run the retrospective gamut of Chet’s career, including:

• renowned tattooist Paul Booth

• award-winning author, filmmaker and former editor of Rue Morgue magazine Jovanka Vuckovic

• film director Guillermo del Toro

Featuring over 150 full-color images of his paintings, sculptures and sketches, plus behind-the-scenes images from his time in the special-effects industry, Black Magick: The Art of Chet Zar is a must-have for anyone who has ever been curious about monsters…or the man behind them.

name: THE DEAD POPE- UNPAINTED RESIN/BLANK CASTING
description:
Unpainted, urethane resin casting
Approx 5x6x15"

This cast is unpainted and unseamed and there may be minor bubbles here and there that need patching. I do my best to pour up a flawless cast, but every blank casting requires a certain amount of patching and seaming before it can be painted. It is being offered for those who like to paint resin kits and blank art toys.

name: GAS MASK LOGO DICHROIC GLASS PENDANT
description:
These beautiful Dichroic Glass pendants are individually handcrafted by my brother, Glass/Neon Artist extraordinaire, Rick Zar. 

Each piece is one of a kind and hand made so they may vary slightly from the photo.

name: FAMOUS MONSTERS GALLERY- DARK ARTS VOLUME 1
description: Famous Monsters of Filmland has always been a place where artists from all walks of life have been able to explore the mischievously monstrous side. FM is now pleased to bring you the Dark Arts, a celebration of some of the best horror, sci-fi, and fantasy artists in the business today. Along with the high-quality, full color ghoulish galleries, each section will include an interview with the artist, providing insight into just what inspires these maddeningly macabre masters. Volume One will include: Richard Corben, Paul Gerrard, Jason Edmiston, Bob Eggleton, Joe DeVito, Ken Kelly, Joe Jusko, and Chet Zar. Over 100 pages, Paperback

name: SKETCH THEATRE- VOLUME 1
description:
(*INTERNATIONAL ORDERS PLEASE NOTE*- Shipping outside of the US is costing $30-45 for these books but for technical reasons, my PayPal will only charge $20 for shipping upon checkout. Please be aware that you will be billed an additional $10-20 for shipping. Sorry about that, but I can't find a cheaper way to ship)

The Art of Sketch Theatre Volume 1 is an inspiring collection of sketches, finished work and insightful profiles by 58 professional artists who have participated in the ongoing SketchTheatre.com project. 

Artists include:

    Aaron Sims
    Aimée Kuester
    Alex Alvarez

name: ART THAT CREEPS- GOTHIC FANTASIES AND THE MACABRE IN CONTEMPORARY ART
description:
Highlighting a selection of artists who eschew the cold, minimalist aesthetic that afflicts contemporary art, this book explores the truly sinister, hyper-real, and riotous blend of pop culture, fine art, and surrealism that is Neo-Gothic art. Associated with punk and dark fantasy, yet distinct from both, these risk-taking artists are represented with a selection of hundreds of amazing paintings from the U.S. and European Neo-Gothic scene. Every painting is captioned in detail, many with explanations of the cutting-edge digital media with which they were created.

Book Includes a 10 page spread on Chet Zar, who also has his work on cover.

Hardcover: 192 pages
Publisher: Korero Books; 1st edition (November 1, 2009)
Language: English
ISBN-10: 0955833671
ISBN-13: 978-0955833670
Product Dimensions: 10.2 x 8.5 x 0.9 inches
